info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 4:16AM EDT until April 6 at 9:50PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana...
Buck Creek at Acton.
Mill Creek near Cataract.
Mississinewa River near Ridgeville.
.Additional widespread heavy rainfall Friday night has led to Minor to Moderate Flooding on several streams and creeks across central Indiana. Flooding will crest on most creeks later today and recede through minor flood later this weekend.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Buck Creek at Acton.
* WHEN...From early this morning to late tomorrow evening.
* IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Extensive lowland flooding along Buck Creek in southeast Marion and northwest Shelby Counties. Flooding affects agricultural and recreational areas. Flooding may affect some residential areas. Shelby CR 700N one quarter of a mile east of Shelby CR 875 is flooded by more than one foot of water especially if Sugar Creek at New Palestine is 8 feet or higher.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 10.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:00 AM EDT Saturday was 10.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.9 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued this evening by around 730 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO LATE TOMORROW EVENING
